analyzed: las ni 'phral gyi dge ba la sogs pa lus ngag yid gsum gyi spyod pa ste /

analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i sgo'i tshig ces pa ni tshig des ting nge 'dzin las yongs su gyur te /

original: skabs 'dir ni rgyu'i dam tshig bshad de /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni rgyu'i dam tshig bshad de /

analyzed: de yang / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba pa'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs pa yin te /

original: de la chos kyi khyad par rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni 'jug pa dang ldang ba dang gnas pa'i sems gsum tha dad pas chos kyi khyad par rnam pa gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi khyad par rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni 'jug pa dang ldang ba dang gnas pa'i sems gsum tha dad pas chos kyi khyad par rnam pa gsum zhes bya'o //

analyzed: chos kyi khyad par gang las sgrib pa med pa'i tshul gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni dam tshig gsum ste zhes sbyar te /

analyzed: des kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes nas sems bskyed pa zhes sbyar te /
translated: This is explained from here up to the wisdom that arises after that.

original: shes rab des chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par shes pa bskyed do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab des chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par shes pa bskyed do zhes pa ste /
translated: The wisdom that arises after that is the wisdom that arises after nonmeditation.üîΩHaving fully understood that as it is, one generates the mind

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i byang chub kyi mtshan @108b nyid ces sbyar bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i byang chub kyi mtshan @108b nyid ces sbyar bar bya ba ste /
translated: it is to be applied as the characteristic of enlightenment free from the entire net of conceptual thoughts.

original: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la yod cing chags par rtog pa ni grol ba'i gegs su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la yod cing chags par rtog pa ni grol ba'i gegs su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The conceptual thought that exists and is attached to the characteristics of phenomena such as the aggregates and elements becomes an obstacle to liberation.

original: rtog pa de nyid dra ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: rtog pa de nyid dra ba zhes bya la /
translated: That conceptual thought itself is called a ‚Äúnet.‚Äù

original: gang rtog pa'i dra ba med pa'i sems ni stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sems te /
analyzed: gang rtog pa'i dra ba med pa'i sems ni stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind that is free from the net of conceptual thought is the mind that realizes emptiness.

original: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of enlightenment.üîΩThat is the first mind.

original: de ni dang po'i sems shes pa'i tshig gong ma dang 'brel te /
analyzed: de ni dang po'i sems shes pa'i tshig gong ma dang 'brel te /
translated: The above words are connected.

original: 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: It is the engaging mind.

original: gnyis pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: The second is nonconceptuality.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang ngo zhes pa ni gnas pa'i sems te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang ngo zhes pa ni gnas pa'i sems te /
translated: The state of perfect buddhahood is the abiding mind.

original: rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad med pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi shes rab de nyid chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs nas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad med pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi shes rab de nyid chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs nas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid la gnas te /
translated: That wisdom, the characteristic of enlightenment, which is free from all the nets of thoughts, having realized that all phenomena are the nature of emptiness, abides in nonconceptuality.

original: de nyid la kun du sangs rgyas pa'i go 'phang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la kun du sangs rgyas pa'i go 'phang zhes bya'o //
translated: That itself is called the state of complete enlightenment.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas kyang zhes pa nas de ni dam tshig gsum mo zhes pa'i bar gyis ldang pa'i sems bshad pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas kyang zhes pa nas de ni dam tshig gsum mo zhes pa'i bar gyis ldang pa'i sems bshad pa ste /
translated: Having seen reality just as it is, up to the three pledges explains the mind of rising.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas kyang zhes pa ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i sems kyis de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs nas kyang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas kyang zhes pa ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i sems kyis de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs nas kyang zhes pa ste /
translated: Having seen reality just as it is means that having realized suchness without error with the mind of entering and abiding,

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid du rtogs nas kyang rnam par mi rtog pa de nyid la mi gnas par sems can gyi don du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid du rtogs nas kyang rnam par mi rtog pa de nyid la mi gnas par sems can gyi don du spyod pa ste /
translated: having realized suchness in that way, one does not abide in that nonconceptuality but engages in conduct for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de bas na sems can gyi khams ma lus pa la bltas nas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi khams ma lus pa la bltas nas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúhaving looked at the realm of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi khams la lta ba de yang dmigs pa dang bcas pas khe dang bkur sti'i phyir lta ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams la lta ba de yang dmigs pa dang bcas pas khe dang bkur sti'i phyir lta ba ni ma yin te /
translated: And that looking at the realm of sentient beings is not a looking for the sake of gain and honor, because it is accompanied by the object.

original: de bas na snying rje'i dbang du gyur pas dmigs su med pa nyid du blta ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na snying rje'i dbang du gyur pas dmigs su med pa nyid du blta ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúhaving looked at the realm of sentient beings, one should look at the absence of an object, because one is governed by compassion.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi sems de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is that thought of enlightenment?

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba mtshan nyid med pa'i byang chub la sems can rnams rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba mtshan nyid med pa'i byang chub la sems can rnams rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúone should establish all sentient beings in the signless enlightenment which is free from all conceptual elaboration.‚Äù

original: mngon par de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas nas kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis snying rje'i dbang du gyur cing dmigs pa med pa nyid du sems can thams cad ji ltar bdag gis rtogs pa'i byang chub rtog pa dang bral zhing sprosüîΩpa thams cad @109a * //
analyzed: mngon par de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas nas kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis snying rje'i dbang du gyur cing dmigs pa med pa nyid du sems can thams cad ji ltar bdag gis rtogs pa'i byang chub rtog pa dang bral zhing spros pa thams cad @109a * //
translated: And while abiding in the nonconceptual suchness, by the power of their previous aspirations, they are moved by compassion and, without any reference point, they cause all sentient beings to realize the same freedom from concepts and elaborations that they themselves have realized.üîΩ

original: dang bral pa mtshan nyid med pa de la dgod par bya'o snyam pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang bral pa mtshan nyid med pa de la dgod par bya'o snyam pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye'o zhes bya'o //
translated: And having abided in the non-conceptual suchness, the mind of enlightenment arises with the force of former aspirations, with the power of compassion, and with the non-apprehension of all sentient beings, thinking, ‚ÄúI will establish all sentient beings in that enlightenment which I have realized, free from conceptualization and free from all elaborations, free from characteristics.‚ÄùüîΩThat is the three pledges.

original: de ni dam tshig gsum mo zhes pa ji skad du smos pa'i 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldan pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de ni dam tshig gsum mo zhes pa ji skad du smos pa'i 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldan pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind that possesses the engagement and abiding as stated, that is the three pledges.

original: gsum po de ni dam tshig gsum mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po de ni dam tshig gsum mo zhes pa'o //
translated: Those three are the three pledges.üîΩLord of Secrets, moreover, what are the three pledges?

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang dam tshig gsum gang zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa la ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sems de dag nyid kyi rnam grangs bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gzhan yang dam tshig gsum gang zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa la ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sems de dag nyid kyi rnam grangs bshad pa ste /
translated: And so on. The explanation of the synonyms of those minds of engagement and so forth is as follows.

original: dang po'i sems ni sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: dang po'i sems ni sangs rgyas te //
translated: The first mind is the Buddha.

original: zhes pa ni dang po 'jug pa'i sems kyi phung po la sogs pa rnams bdag med par rtogs pas na sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dang po 'jug pa'i sems kyi phung po la sogs pa rnams bdag med par rtogs pas na sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: The first is called Buddha because it realizes the aggregates, etc., as selfless.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshig ni rtogs pa zhes pa dang rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshig ni rtogs pa zhes pa dang rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word Buddha is a synonym for realization.

original: gnyis pa yang ni chos zhes bya //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ni chos zhes bya //
translated: The second is called Dharma.

original: zhes pa ni gnas pa'i sems te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnas pa'i sems te /
translated: The second is the abiding mind.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called Dharma because it holds the characteristic of the nature of reality.

original: de dang lhan cig byung ba'i sems //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig byung ba'i sems //
translated: The mind that arises together with that

original: dge 'dun zhes ni bshad pa yin //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes ni bshad pa yin //
translated: is explained as the Sangha.

original: zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong par rtogs pa'i tshe nyid na snying rje'i dbang gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi mtshan nyid lha rnams kyi skur bsgyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong par rtogs pa'i tshe nyid na snying rje'i dbang gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi mtshan nyid lha rnams kyi skur bsgyur ba la bya'o //
translated: When all things are realized as empty, the bodhisattva Sangha of the stage of nonretrogression, by the power of compassion, is transformed into the bodies of the gods.

original: dpa' bo dam tshig de gsum ni //
analyzed: dpa' bo dam tshig de gsum ni //
translated: Those three pledges of the hero

original: 'dren pa rnams kyis khyod la bshad //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams kyis khyod la bshad //
translated: are explained to you, O Leader.

original: ces pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i dam tshig gsum po 'di dang nga 'ba' zhig gis dpa' bo khyod la bshad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ces pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i dam tshig gsum po 'di dang nga 'ba' zhig gis dpa' bo khyod la bshad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not just me, the sole speaker, explaining these three pledges to you, the hero.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dren pa rnams kyis kyang bshad do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dren pa rnams kyis kyang bshad do zhes pa ste /
translated: The former Bhagavat Buddhas, the guides, also explained them.

original: sangs rgyas rnams spyod pa gcig tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams spyod pa gcig tu bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that the Buddhas have a single practice.

original: de tshe sna tshogs tshul gyi sgos //
analyzed: de tshe sna tshogs tshul gyi sgos //
translated: At that time, with various methods,

original: dpa' bo sems can phan 'dod pas //
analyzed: dpa' bo sems can phan 'dod pas //
translated: the hero who wishes to benefit sentient beings,

original: dam tshig gsum po 'di dag la //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum po 'di dag la //
translated: abiding in these three pledges,

original: gnas nas byang chub spyad pa spyod //üîΩces pa ni byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa rnams dam tshig gsum po 'di la gnas nas /
analyzed: gnas nas byang chub spyad pa spyod // ces pa ni byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa rnams dam tshig gsum po 'di la gnas nas /
translated: practices the conduct of enlightenment.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi tshul mang po dang 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan @109b thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tshul sna tshogs kyi sgo nas sems can gyi phyir spyod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi tshul mang po dang 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan @109b thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tshul sna tshogs kyi sgo nas sems can gyi phyir spyod do zhes pa'o //
translated: This shows that the bodhisattvas who practice the conduct of enlightenment, abiding in these three pledges, practice for the sake of sentient beings with many worldly methods and with various transcendent methods of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gang gi tshe sku gsum la mnga' mdzad pa de dag rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa de'i tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'bras bu'i dam tshig gsum bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po gang gi tshe sku gsum la mnga' mdzad pa de dag rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa de'i tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'bras bu'i dam tshig gsum bstan pa ste /
translated: This and the rest teaches the three pledges of the result.

original: nam kun du sangs rgyas par gyur pa de'i tshe sprul pa'i skus sangs rgyas yab zas gcang ma'i sras su ston pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du ston te /
analyzed: nam kun du sangs rgyas par gyur pa de'i tshe sprul pa'i skus sangs rgyas yab zas gcang ma'i sras su ston pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du ston te /
translated: When they have become fully enlightened, at that time, the emanation body teaches from the display of being the son of King Shuddhodana to the display of passing into nirvana.

original: de la sku gsum la mdzad pa zhes pa nam 'og min gyi gnas su kun du sangs rgyas par gyur pa de nyid kyi tshe na chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa ni chos kyi sku la mnga'
analyzed: de la sku gsum la mdzad pa zhes pa nam 'og min gyi gnas su kun du sangs rgyas par gyur pa de nyid kyi tshe na chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa ni chos kyi sku la mnga'
translated: Regarding that, mastery over the three bodies means that when they have become fully enlightened in the Akanishtha realm, at that time, the realization of all phenomena as emptiness becomes the nature of suchness, which is mastery over the dharmakaya.

original: mdzad pa'o // de'i tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang bas na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la mnga' mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa'o // de'i tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang bas na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la mnga' mdzad pa'o //
translated: At that time, since they appear as the sambhogakaya, it is mastery over the sambhogakaya.

original: de nas sprul pa'i sku 'jig rten du snang bas na sprul pa'i sku la mnga' mdzad pa'o //
